name: SuperResolution
description: The SuperResolution tool enhances the spatial resolution of input images. The 'gradientSigma' parameter is used in calculating the gradient magnitude of the input images for weighting the voxel points during fitting. If a negative 'gradient' sigma is specified then no weighting is used.

inputs.name: Image Dimension
inputs.description: Specifies the dimensionality of the input images (e.g., 2 for 2D images, 3 for 3D images).

inputs.name: Output Image
inputs.description: The file path for the output super-resolved image.

inputs.name: Domain Image
inputs.description: The domain image is used as the template space for the alignment of input images.

inputs.name: Gradient Sigma
inputs.description: The sigma used for calculating the gradient magnitude of input images. If negative, no weighting is applied.

inputs.name: Mesh Size
inputs.description: The size of the mesh used in fitting.

inputs.name: Number of Levels
inputs.description: The number of resolution levels to process.

inputs.name: Input Image Files
inputs.description: List of paths to input images to be processed for super resolution.

author: ANTs Developers
